1.text: Also, at this my heart trembleth, And it moveth from its place.

2.text: Hearken diligently to the trembling of His voice, Yea, the sound from His mouth goeth forth.

3.text: Under the whole heavens He directeth it, And its light is over the skirts of the earth.

4.text: After it roar doth a voice—He thundereth with the voice of His excellency, And He doth not hold them back, When His voice is heard.

5.text: God thundereth with His voice wonderfully, Doing great things and we know not.

6.text: For to snow He saith, ‘Be on the earth.’ And the small rain and great rain of His power.

7.text: Into the hand of every man he sealeth, For the knowledge by all men of His work.

8.text: And enter doth the beast into covert, And in its habitations it doth continue.

9.text: From the inner chamber cometh a hurricane, And from scatterings winds—cold,

10.text: From the breath of God is frost given, And the breadth of waters is straitened,

11.text: Yea, by filling He doth press out a cloud, Scatter a cloud doth His light.

12.text: And it is turning itself round by His counsels, For their doing all He commandeth them, On the face of the habitable earth.

13.text: Whether for a rod, or for His land, Or for kindness—He doth cause it to come.

14.text: Hear this, O Job, Stand and consider the wonders of God.

15.text: Dost thou know when God doth place them, And caused to shine the light of His cloud?

16.text: Dost thou know the balancings of a cloud? The wonders of the Perfect in knowledge?

17.text: How thy garments are warm, In the quieting of the earth from the south?

18.text: Thou hast made an expanse with Him For the clouds—strong as a hard mirror!

19.text: Let us know what we say to Him, We set not in array because of darkness.

20.text: Is it declared to Him that I speak? If a man hath spoken, surely he is swallowed up.

21.text: And now, they have not seen the light, Bright it is in the clouds, And the wind hath passed by and cleanseth them.

22.text: From the golden north it cometh, Beside God is fearful honour.

23.text: The Mighty! we have not found Him out, High in power and judgment, He doth not answer! And abundant in righteousness,

24.text: Therefore do men fear Him, He seeth not any of the wise of heart.
